The image was shared on Facebook and Ins: 2. Microbiologists, including Emad El-Omar and Dr. Richard E. Davis, have stated that the claim is misleading and the image is sensationalist. They explain that the petri dish shows a heavy growth of fungi, not just bacteria, indicating that the dish has been incubating for a long time and is contaminated by mold spores from the air.
Dr: Richard E. Davis also points out that the microbes shown in the photo are unlikely to cause disease and that the image falsely implies that wearing a mask exposes one to disease-causing microbes.
The original source of the image could n: and AFP has fact-checked multiple false and misleading social media posts about face masks, including some related to this claim.
